Welcome to idp-modem’s documentation!¶

idpmodem¶

Data structure and operations for a SkyWave/ORBCOMM IsatData Pro (IDP) modem using AT commands.

IDP is a store-and-forward satellite messaging technology with messages structured as:

Service Identifier Number (1 byte SIN) Payload (up to 6399 bytes MO or 9999 bytes MT)

Where the first byte of Payload can optionally be defined as a Message Identifier Number (MIN) to facilitate decoding.

  • MO = Mobile Originated aka Return aka From-Mobile message sent from modem to cloud application
  • MT = Mobile Terminated aka Forward message aka To-Mobile message sent from cloud application to modem

Upon power-up or reset, the modem first acquires its location using Global Navigation Satellite Systems (GNSS). After getting its location, the modem tunes to the correct frequency, then registers on the network. Prolonged obstruction of satellite signal will put the modem into a “blockage” state from which it will automatically try to recover based on an algorithm influenced by its power mode setting.

Todo

  • Reference contextual documentation pages for things like event notifications, low power, etc.
  • Internalize threads for typical monitoring processes to callback to registered external functions
class idpmodem.Modem(serial_port, log=None, debug=False, *callbacks)¶

Abstracts attributes and statistics related to an IDP modem

Parameters:
  • serial_port – a pySerial.serial object
  • log – an optional logger
  • debug – Boolean option for verbose trace
  • callbacks –

    optional dictionary of callback functions for

    • all below events
    • sat_status satellite status change e.g. registration, blockage
    • new_mt_message message received over-the-air
    • mo_message_complete message sent or failed
    • wakeup_interval_change
    • new_gnss_fix
    • trace_event for configured trace events that would assert the notification pin
at_attach(at_timeout=1)¶

Attempts to attach using basic AT command.

Returns:Boolean success
at_check_mt_messages()¶

Checks for Mobile-Terminated messages in modem queue and retrieves if present. Logs a record of the receipt, and handles supported messages.

Returns:
  • Boolean True if message(s) have been received/completed and ready for retrieval
  • list of dictionary messages consisting of
    • name used for retrieval
    • priority 0 for mobile-terminated messages
    • num number assigned by modem
    • sin Service Identifier Number (decimal 0..255)
    • state where 2 = complete and ready to retrieve
    • size including SIN and MIN bytes
at_check_sat_status()¶

Checks satellite status and updates state and statistics.

Returns:A dictionary with:
  • success Boolean
  • changed Boolean
  • state (string from ctrl_states)
at_get_event_notify_assert_bitmap()¶

Returns the Event Notification Assert Status (S89) bitmap as an integer value. See event notification bitmap

Note

This operation clears the S89 register upon reading.

Returns:(integer) event notification assert status (e.g. 2 = new Mobile Terminated Message received)
at_get_event_notify_control_bitmap()¶

Returns the Event Notification Control (S88) bitmap as an integer value, and updates the event_notifications attribute of the Modem instance.

Event Notifications:

  • newGnssFix (bit 0) the modem has acquired new time/position from GNSS (e.g. GPS, GLONASS)
  • newMtMsg (bit 1) a new Mobile-Terminated (aka Forward) message has been received over-the-air
  • moMsgComplete (bit 2) a Mobile-Originated (aka Return) message has completed sending over-the-air
  • modemRegistered (bit 3) the modem has registered on the satellite network
  • modemReset (bit 4) the modem has just reset
  • jamCutState (bit 5) the modem has detected antenna cut or GNSS signal jamming
  • modemResetPending (bit 6) a modem reset has been requested (typically received over-the-air)
  • lowPowerChange (bit 7) the modem’s low power wakeup interval has been changed
  • utcUpdate (bit 8) the modem has received a system time update/correction
  • fixTimeout (bit 9) the latest GNSS location request has timed out (unable to acquire GNSS/location)
  • eventCached (bit 10) a requested event has been cached for retrieval using capture trace S-registers
Returns:(integer) event notification bitmap (e.g. 139 = newGnssFix, newMtMsg, modemRegistered, lowPowerChange)
at_get_mt_message(msg_name, msg_sin, msg_size, data_type=2)¶

Retrieves a pending completed mobile-terminated message.

Parameters:
  • msg_name – to be retrieved
  • msg_sin – to be retrieved
  • msg_size – to be retrieved
  • data_type – 1 = Text, 2 = Hex, 3 = base64
Returns:

  • Boolean success
  • dictionary message consisting of:
    • sin Service Identifier Number
    • min Message Identifier Number
    • payload including MIN byte, structure depends on data_type (text, hex, base64)
    • size total in bytes including SIN, MIN
at_get_nmea(rmc=True, gga=True, gsa=True, gsv=True, refresh=0)¶

Queries GNSS NMEA strings from the modem and returns an array.

Parameters:
  • gga – essential fix data
  • rmc – recommended minimum
  • gsa – dilution of precision (DOP) and satellites
  • gsv – satellites in view
  • refresh – the update rate being used, in seconds
Returns:

  • Boolean success
  • list of NMEA sentences requested
at_get_response(at_cmd, at_timeout=10)¶

Takes a single AT command, applies CRC if enabled, sends to the modem and waits for response completion. Parses the response, line by line, until a result code is received or at_timeout is exceeded. Assumes Quiet mode is disabled, and will not pass ‘Quiet enable’ (ATQ1) to the modem. Sets modem object properties (Echo, CRC, Verbose, Quiet) by inference from AT response.

Parameters:
  • at_cmd – the AT command to send
  • at_timeout – the time in seconds to wait for a response
Returns:

a dictionary containing:

  • echo the AT command sent (including CRC if applied) or empty string if Echo disabled
  • response a list of (stripped) strings representing multi-line response
  • result a string returned after the response when Quiet mode is disabled
    ’OK’ or ‘ERROR’ if Verbose is enabled on the modem, or a numeric error code that can be looked up in idpmodem.atErrorResultCodes
  • checksum the CRC (if enabled) or None
  • error Boolean if CRC is correct
  • timeout Boolean if AT response timed out
at_get_result_code(result_code)¶

Queries the details of an error response on the AT command interface.

Parameters:result_code – the value returned by the AT command response
Returns:
  • the specific error code
  • the string description of the error code
at_initialize_modem(use_crc=False, verbose=True)¶

Initializes the modem after new connection. Restores saved defaults, disables Quiet mode, enables Echo.

Note

CRC use is recommended when using a long cable between your controller and the satellite modem.

Parameters:
  • use_crc – optionally enables CRC on AT commands (e.g. if using long serial cable)
  • verbose – optionally use verbose mode for results (OK/ERROR)
Returns:

Boolean success
at_save_config()¶

Store the current configuration including all S registers.

at_send_message(data_string, data_format=1, msg_sin=128, msg_min=1, priority=4)¶

Transmits a Mobile-Originated message. If ASCII-Hex format is used, 0-pads to nearest byte boundary.

Parameters:
  • data_string – data to be transmitted
  • data_format – 1=Text (default), 2=ASCII-Hex, 3=base64
  • msg_sin – first byte of message (default 128 “user”)
  • msg_min – second byte of message (default 1 “user”)
  • priority – 1(high) through 4(low, default)
Returns:

Boolean result
at_set_event_notification_control_bitmap(value, save=False)¶

Sets the event notifications bitmap using an integer mask. Truncates the bitmap if too large.

Parameters:
  • value – integer to set the S88 register bitmap
  • save – Boolean whether to write to Non-Volatile Memory
Returns:

Boolean result
at_set_gnss_dpm(value, save=False)¶

Sets the GNSS Dynamic Platform model (S33, default 0). gnss_dpm_mode is an enumerated type:

  • Portable: 0
  • Stationary: 2
  • Pedestrian: 3
  • Automotive: 4
  • Sea: 5
  • Air 1g: 6
  • Air 2g: 7
  • Air 4g: 8

Note

Check with modem manufacturer to confirm available GNSS settings on your hardware variant.

Parameters:
  • value – an enumerated type
  • save – if writing to NVM
Returns:

Boolean success
get_event_notification_assertions()¶

Returns a dictionary with the events that triggered the notification assert pin, by calling at_get_event_notify_assert_bitmap.

Note

This function is meant to be called only after the physical modem has asserted its notification output. Calling this function clears all status conditions upon reading.

Todo

Testing incomplete.

Returns:an OrderedDict with Boolean values against event keys
  • newGnssFix the modem has acquired new time/position from GNSS (e.g. GPS, GLONASS)
  • newMtMsg a new Mobile-Terminated (aka Forward) message has been received over-the-air
  • moMsgComplete a Mobile-Originated (aka Return) message has completed sending over-the-air
  • modemRegistered the modem has registered on the satellite network
  • modemReset the modem has just reset
  • jamCutState the modem has detected antenna cut or GNSS signal jamming
  • modemResetPending a modem reset has been requested (typically received over-the-air)
  • lowPowerChange the modem’s low power wakeup interval has been changed
  • utcUpdate the modem has received a system time update/correction
  • fixTimeout the latest GNSS location request has timed out (unable to acquire GNSS/location)
  • eventCached a requested event has been cached for retrieval using capture trace S-registers
get_event_notification_control()¶

Updates the event_notifications attribute by calling at_get_event_notify_control_bitmap.

Returns:An OrderedDict corresponding to the event_notifications attribute.
get_gnss_continuous()¶

Gets the GNSS continuous interval (S55, default 0) and stores in the Modem instance.

get_gnss_dpm()¶

Gets the GNSS Dynamic Platform Model (S33, default 0) and stores in Modem instance.

get_gnss_mode()¶

Gets the GNSS mode (S39, default 0) and stores in the Modem instance.

get_power_mode()¶

Gets the power mode (S50, default 0) and stores in the Modem instance.

get_statistics()¶

Returns a dictionary of operating statistics for the modem/network.

Returns:dictionary of strings and KPI values containing key statistics
get_wakeup_interval()¶

Gets the wakeup interval (S51, default 0) and stores in the Modem instance.

log_at_config()¶

Logs/displays the current AT configuration options (e.g. CRC, Verbose, Echo, Quiet) on the console.

log_sat_status()¶

Logs/displays the current satellite status on the console.

log_statistics()¶

Logs the modem/network statistics.

Sets a particular event monitoring status in the event notification bitmap.

Parameters:
  • key – event name as defined in the OrderedDict
  • value – Boolean to set/clear the bit
  • save – Boolean to store the configuration to Non-Volatile Memory
Returns:

Boolean success
set_gnss_continuous(value, save=False)¶

Sets the GNSS continuous mode refresh interval (S55, default 0).

Parameters:
  • value – (integer) seconds between refresh from 0..30. 0=disabled/on-demand.
  • save – if writing to NVM
Returns:

Boolean success
set_gnss_mode(value, save=False)¶

Sets the GNSS mode (S39) (GPS, GLONASS, Beidou). gnss_mode is an enumerated type:

  • GPS: 0
  • GLONASS: 1
  • BEIDOU: 2
  • GPS+GLONASS: 10
  • GPS+BEIDOU: 11
  • GLONASS+BEIDOU: 12

Note

Check with modem manufacturer to confirm available GNSS settings on your hardware variant.

Parameters:
  • value – an enumerated type
  • save – if writing to NVM
Returns:

Boolean success
set_power_mode(value, save=False)¶

Sets the power mode (S50, default 0). power_mode is an enumerated type with:

  • Mobile Powered: 0
  • Fixed Powered: 1
  • Mobile Battery: 2
  • Fixed Battery: 3
  • Mobile Minimal: 4
  • Mobile Stationary: 5
Parameters:
  • value – an enumerated type
  • save – if writing to NVM
Returns:

Boolean success
set_wakeup_interval(value, save=False)¶

Sets the wakeup interval (S51, default 0).

wakeup_interval is an enumerated type:

  • 5 seconds: 0
  • 30 seconds: 1
  • 1 minute: 2
  • 3 minute: 3
  • 10 minute: 4
  • 30 minute: 5
  • 60 minute: 6
  • 2 minute: 7
  • 5 minute: 8
  • 15 minute: 9
  • 20 minute: 10
Parameters:
  • value – an enumerated type
  • save – if writing to NVM
Returns:

Boolean success
class idpmodem.Message(name=None, msg_sin=255, msg_min=255, payload_b64=None)¶

Class intended for abstracting message characteristics.

add_field(name, data_type, value, bit_size)¶

Add a field to the message.

Parameters:
  • name – (string)
  • data_type – (string) from supported types
  • value – the value (compliant with data_type)
  • bit_size – string formatter ‘0nb’ where n is number of bits
Returns:

  • error code
  • error string
delete_field(name)¶

Remove a field from the message.

Parameters:name – of field (string)
Returns:
  • error code (0 = no error)
  • error string description (0 = “OK”)
encode_idp(data_format=2)¶

Encodes the message using the specified data format (Text, Hex, base64).

Parameters:data_format – 1=Text, 2=ASCII-Hex, 3=base64
Returns:encoded_payload (string) to pass into AT%MGRT
class idpmodem.MobileOriginatedMessage(name=None, msg_sin=255, msg_min=255, payload_b64=None)¶

Class containing Mobile Originated (aka Return) message properties. Initializes Mobile Originated (Return) Message with state = UNAVAILABLE Return States enumeration (per modem documentation):

  • UNAVAILABLE: 0
  • READY: 4
  • SENDING: 5
  • COMPLETE: 6
  • FAILED: 7
Parameters:
  • name – identifier for the message (tbd limitations)
  • msg_sin – Service Identification Number (1st byte of payload)
  • msg_min – Message Identification Number (2nd byte of payload)
  • payload_b64 – (optional) base64 encoded payload (not including SIN/MIN)
class idpmodem.MobileTerminatedMessage(name=None, msg_sin=255, msg_min=255, payload_b64=None)¶

Class containing Mobile Terminated (aka Forward) message properties. Initializes Mobile Terminated (Forward) Message with state = UNAVAILABLE Forward States enumeration (per modem documentation):

  • UNAVAILABLE: 0
  • COMPLETE: 2
  • RETRIEVED: 3
Parameters:
  • name –
  • msg_sin –
  • msg_min –
  • payload_b64 –

crcxmodem¶

Calculates CRC-16-CCITT checksum for xmodem, intended for use with SkyWave/ORBCOMM IDP modem.
Borrowed from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25239423/crc-ccitt-16-bit-python-manual-calculation.
crcxmodem.crc(string, initial=65535)¶

Returns the CRC value.

Parameters:
  • string – to have CRC calculated on
  • initial – start value of CRC (0xFFFF for IDP modem)
Returns:

crc value
crcxmodem.crc_bytes(*i)¶

Returns the CRC value of a byte stream.

Parameters:i – byte stream
Returns:crc value

idpmodemsample¶

Sample program to run on Raspberry Pi (headless) or Windows (using ORBCOMM/SkyWave Modem Simulator) or Multitech Conduit with serial mCard (AP1 slot). Periodically queries modem status, checks for incoming messages and sends location reports

Dependencies:
  • (REQUIRED) crcxmodem.py calculates CRC-16-CCITT xmodem
  • (REQUIRED) idpmodem.py contains object definitions for the modem
  • (optional) RPi.GPIO for running headless on Raspberry Pi
  • (optional) serialportfinder.py is used when running on Windows test environment (detect COM port)

Mobile-Originated location reports are 17 bytes using SIN 255 MIN 255 Mobile-Terminated location interval change uses SIN 255 MIN 1, plus 1 byte payload for the new interval in minutes. When a new interval is configured, a location report is generated immediately, thereafter at the new interval.

Todo

  • Extract generic functions/modules such as wrapping logger, RepeatingTimer, NMEA parsing
  • Embed modem process threads within idpmodem with registered callbacks
  • Restructure parse_args for automagic documentation with sphinx argparse extension
class idpmodemsample.HMI¶

A Human Machine Interface element that can be used for headless operation. Examples: LED indicator, buzzer.

Todo

Non-functional. Develop this concept.

Returns:HMI object (non-functional)
class idpmodemsample.Location(latitude=5460000, longitude=10860000, altitude=0, speed=0, heading=0, timestamp=0, satellites=0, fixtype=1, PDOP=0, HDOP=0, VDOP=0)¶

A class containing a specific set of location-based information for a given point in time. Uses 91/181 if lat/lon are unknown

Parameters:
  • latitude – in 1/1000th minutes (approximately 1 m resolution)
  • longitude – in 1/1000th minutes (approximately 1 m resolution)
  • altitude – in metres
  • speed – in knots
  • heading – in degrees
  • timestamp – in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z
  • satellites – in view at time of fix
  • fixtype – None, 2D or 3D
  • PDOP – Probability Dilution of Precision
  • HDOP – Horizontal DOP
  • VDOP – Vertical DOP
class idpmodemsample.ModemGPIO¶

Physical input/output interfaces for the modem e.g. reset, interrupts

Todo

Non-functional. Develop this concept, perhaps internalized within idpmodem.

Returns:GPIO object (non-functional)
class idpmodemsample.RepeatingTimer(seconds, name=None, sleep_chunk=0.25, callback=None, *args)¶

A Thread class that repeats function calls like a Timer but can be stopped, restarted and change interval.

Parameters:
  • seconds – interval for timer repeat
  • name – used to identify the thread
  • sleep_chunk – tick cycle in seconds between state checks
  • callback – the callback to execute each timer expiry
  • args – optional arguments to pass into the callback
change_interval(seconds)¶

Change the timer interval and restart it.

restart_timer()¶

Restart the repeating timer.

run()¶

Counts down the interval, checking every sleep_chunk the desired state.

start_timer()¶

Initially start the repeating timer.

stop_timer()¶

Stop the repeating timer.

terminate()¶

Terminate the timer. (Cannot be restarted)

idpmodemsample.check_mt_messages()¶

Checks for Mobile-Terminated messages in modem queue, retrieves and handles.

idpmodemsample.check_sat_status()¶

Checks satellite status using Trace Log Mode to update state and statistics

idpmodemsample.get_send_idp_location()¶

Queries GPS NMEA strings from the modem and submits to a send/processing routine.

idpmodemsample.handle_mt_tracking_command(message, data_type=2)¶

Expects to get SIN 255 MIN 1 to reconfigure tracking interval, in minutes, in a range from 1-1440.

Parameters:
  • message –

    dictionary for Mobile-Terminated message with

    • sin Service Identifier Number
    • min Message Identifier Number
    • payload (including MIN byte)
    • size in bytes including SIN, MIN
  • data_type – 1 = Text (string), 2 = Hex (bytearray), 3 = base64 (bytearray)
idpmodemsample.init_environment(default_logfile=None, debug=False)¶

Initializes the OS environment.

Parameters:
  • default_logfile – name to use
  • debug – Boolean value passed in from execution options
Returns:

  • Boolean success
  • Dictionary containing
    • serial_name e.g. COM1
    • logfile e.g. logfile.log
    • tracking interval in seconds
    • debug value (may be overridden by Windows GUI)
idpmodemsample.init_log(logfile=None, file_size=5, debug=False)¶

Initializes logging to file and console.

Parameters:
  • logfile – the name of the file
  • file_size – the max size of the file in megabytes, before wrapping occurs
  • debug – Boolean to enable verbose logging
Returns:

log object
idpmodemsample.main()¶

Sets up threads for polling satellite status, incoming over-the-air messages, and location updates. Monitors the serial connection to the modem and re-initializes on reconnect.

idpmodemsample.modem_attach(max_attempts=0, hmi_indicator=None)¶

Initializes communications with the modem. Allows for HMI indicator use.

Parameters:
  • max_attempts – the maximum number of tries sending a basic AT command (0 = infinite)
  • hmi_indicator – an optional object to provide headless notification (LED flasher)
Returns:

Boolean success
idpmodemsample.monitor_com(disconnect_timeouts=3)¶

Monitors the serial communication to detect disconnects/reconnects.

Parameters:disconnect_timeouts – the number of command timeouts before disconnect is declared
Returns:serial connection state to satellite modem
idpmodemsample.parse_args(argv)¶

Parses the command line arguments.

Parameters:argv – An array containing the command line arguments
Returns:A dictionary containing the command line arguments and their values
idpmodemsample.parse_nmea_to_location(sentence, loc)¶

Parses a NMEA string to partially populate a Location object. Several sentence parameters are unused but remain as placeholders for completeness/future use.

Parameters:
  • sentence – NMEA sentence (including prefix and suffix)
  • loc – the Location object to be populated
Returns:

  • Boolean success of operation
  • error string if not successful
idpmodemsample.send_idp_location(loc)¶

Prepares a specific binary-optimized location report using SIN=255, MIN=255.

Parameters:loc – a Location object
Returns:Boolean success
idpmodemsample.validate_nmea_checksum(sentence)¶

Validates NMEA sentence using checksum according to the standard.

Parameters:sentence – NMEA sentence including checksum
Returns:
  • Boolean result (checksum correct)
  • raw NMEA data string, with prefix $Gx and checksum suffix removed
